com.android.slackandhay.grid
Class Grid<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.android.slackandhay.grid.Grid<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object which can occupy grid cells
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridWorld
public abstract class Grid<T>
extends java.lang.Object

A continuous piece of the world, divided into evenly distributed cells of equal size. Each cell can either be empty or hold exactly one object of type T.

Author:
til

Field Detail

TAG

private static final java.lang.String TAG

width

height

protected final int height

scale

protected final float scale

origin

protected final PointF origin

cells

private final T[] cells

directions

private final GridDirection[] directions

Calculate the direction of the shortest path from one grid cell to another.

Starting from the cell with startID, this is the direction of the neighboring cell which is closest to the cell with destinationID.

If one of the ids is invalid, the neutral direction will be returned.

Constructor Detail

Grid

public Grid(int width,
            int height,
            PointF origin,
            float scale)
A continuous piece of the world, divided into evenly distributed cells of equal size. Each cell can either be empty or hold exactly one object of type T.

Parameters:
width - max horizontal number of cells in the grid
height - max vertical number of cells in the grid
origin - the top-left point covered by the grid, in world coordinates
scale - max side length of a cell in world length units

pointToID

public int pointToID(float xf,
                     float yf)
Converts a pair of world coordinates into a valid grid id. If the given point is located outside the grid, the id of the closest grid cell is returned.

Parameters:
xf -
yf -
Returns:

idToPoint

@Deprecated
public void idToPoint(int id,
                                 PointF targetPoint)
Deprecated. use idToPointX and idToPointY instead

Converts a valid grid id into world coordinates and stores them in targetPoint.

This way of returning results is used to avoid instantiating PointF and, eventually, triggering the garbage collector while the game is running on Android.

Parameters:
id -
targetPoint -

Returns the object contained in the grid cell closest to the given point. If no such object exists, null is returned.

get

public T get(int id)
Returns the object contained in the grid cell with the given id. If no such object exists, or if the id is invalid, null is returned.

Parameters:
id -
Returns:
Returns the object contained in the grid cell with the given id. If no such object exists, or if the id is invalid, null is returned.

put

public int put(float xf,
               float yf,
               T obj)
Puts an object into the grid cell closest to the point given, if this cell is empty. If the cell is already occupied, the object will not be put anywhere.

Parameters:
xf -
yf -
obj -
Returns:
the id of the cell the object ended up in, or a value < 0 (= an invalid id), if put was not successful.

put

public boolean put(int id,
                   T obj)
Puts an object into the grid cell with the id given. If the cell is already occupied, or if the given id is invalid (doesn't exist), the object will not be put anywhere, and false will be returned.

Parameters:
id -
obj -
Returns:
true if the object was put into the desired cell.

remove

public T remove(float xf,
                float yf)
Remove the object in the grid cell closest to the given point and return it.

Parameters:
xf -
yf -
Returns:
the removed object, or, if no object was removed, null.

remove

public T remove(int id)
Remove the object contained in the grid cell with the given id and return it. If the cell is not occupied, or if the id is invalid, null will be returned.

Parameters:
id -
Returns:
the removed object, or, if no object was removed, null.

transformIDbyDirection

public int transformIDbyDirection(int startID,
                                  GridDirection direction)

Compute a neighboring id: return the id of the grid cell bordering on the cell with id startID in the given direction.

If the starting cell is on the grid border and the direction points outside the grid, the id returned will belong to the starting cell or one of its neighbors on the border. If an invalid id is supplied as an argument, a value < 0 will be returned.

Parameters:
startID -
direction -
Returns:
the grid id that is next in the given direction. < 0 if startID is invalid.

calculateSquaredDistance

public int calculateSquaredDistance(int id1,
                                    int id2)
Parameters:
id1 -
id2 -
Returns:
the square of the distance (in grid units) between the grid cells with the given id's, or, if an invalid id is provided, a negative value.

                                            int destinationID)

rawXYToID

public int rawXYToID(int x,
                     int y)
Convert two raw grid coordinates (in grid units) to an id. Now validation or verification is done: coordinates outside the grid will be clamped to the nearest valid value.

Parameters:
x -
y -
Returns:

xFromID

private int xFromID(int id)
Extract the horizontal grid coordinate from an id. No checking is done: coordinates outside the grid may yield an invalid value.

Parameters:
id -
Returns:
a value in raw grid units that is not adjusted for grid offset or scale.

yFromID

private int yFromID(int id)
Extract the vertical grid coordinate from an id. No checking is done: an invalid id may return coordinates outside the grid.

Parameters:
id -
Returns:
a value in raw grid units that is not adjusted for grid offset or scale.

clampX

private int clampX(int x)
Limits a value to valid horizontal grid coordinates, which is an integer between 0 and width-1. Values beyond these limits will be set to the nearest limit.

Parameters:
x -
Returns:
the integer between 0 and width-1 closest to x

clampY

private int clampY(int y)
Limits a value to valid vertical grid coordinates, which is an integer between 0 and height-1. Values beyond these limits will be set to the nearest limit.

Parameters:
y -
Returns:
the integer between 0 and height-1 closest to y
